Philippe Coval is a FLOSS enthusiast and GNU/Linux user since mid 1990s, since then, he has contributed to various communities such as Debian, Openmoko, Maemo, Meego, Qt, Tizen, IoTivity, OE/Yocto, Mozilla...

As a software engineer, he has worked in many different contexts. He was lucky to be part of rare OpenSource teams supported by Industry (Intel, Samsung). His current main focus is about Privacy By Design IoT. Feel free to reach him if you need community support about free software or open hardware generally and Web+IoT in particular. Catch him either online or at some FLOSS events.

Puneet Pushkar is a pre-final year student, a data science practitioner his major works revolve around sentiment analysis and scrapping.

He actively takes technical as well as a non-technical session in his university, on topics from making your carrier in computer science, paths for data science "to" a healthy internet, free software India movement, and getting started with open source contribution.

Open Source is everything for him, the libraries he uses (TensorFlow, PyTorch) the Operating System in his phone everything revolves around open source, the sense of contributing and getting his contributions accepted are the things that motivate him to learn more and more.

His Contribution does not completely revolve around coding, but also the documentation, making language diversity, testing and making the technology accessible to the people are some of the ways he contributes to Open Source

Learning, Community Building and Sharing his learning experience is the thing that he follows in day to day basis

**Jyotsna**, an Open Source Enthusiast, is working as a Software Developer in Bangalore India. She’s a coder by profession and Shuttler by passion. She is involved with Mozilla India Community since 2015. She began her journey as an _FSA_ and went on to become the Founder & Club Lead of Firefox Club of BBDNIIT in 2015 April.

Previously, she has contributed to _Firefox OS App Development_, _Localisation_, _QA_, and _SuMo_.

She has served on Mozilla's **Featured Add-ons Advisory Board** thrice (July 2017- Dec 2017) (Jan 2018 - June 2018), (Jan 2019 - June 2019). She was also one of the 5 **judges** on the panel in the **Firefox Quantum Extension Challenge**, ran globally from March 15, 2018 - April 15, 2018.

She is also a Firefox Add-on Mentor and has published a privacy-themed add-on **PrivateX**. Currently, she is a **Mozilla Tech Speaker** and an **Add-on Content Reviewer** and has also been highlighted as **Friend of Add-ons** in the last quarter of 2018 on Add-ons blog < https://blog.mozilla.org/addons/2018/11/07/friend-of-add-ons-jyotsna-gupta/ >

Viral Parmar is a serial entrepreneur who runs ComExpo Cyber Security Foundation a non-profit organization in India. He is a Developer Advocate, Productivity Hacker, Open Source Strategist, Technology Evangelist, Community Liaison, International TechSpeaker. He is a Cyber Security researcher by profession and open source enthusiast working in the field of information security from last four years with the expertise in Cyber Crime Investigation, Public Key Infrastructure, Social Engineering, Web App Penetration Testing, Digital Forensics, Data protection and Privacy Policy. He found severe vulnerability in 150+ well known websites like Intel, Yourstory and solved more than 200 cases of cybercrime & online frauds. He became well-known because of his research on Cyber Disorder and Who is spying on you.


He started a World's biggest Privacy awareness campaign named "Logout" to aware people about privacy and security and till now has given more than 300+ talks and workshops. Also invited in international conferences like MozFest 2017 London, DevConf 2018 India, 614Con 2018 USA, CryptoRave 2018 Brazil, OSCAL 2018 Albania, AllThingsOpen 2018 USA, LISA 2018 USA, PyBITS 2018 India, DevTalks 2018 Romania, PyTennessee 2019, PyTexas 2019, BSidesOK 2019, DevConf 2019 Czechia , DevTalks 2019 Romania, Devconf 2019 India, PyThailand 2019, PyIndiana 2019, Pycon 2019 Nigeria , Geekcamp 2019 Singapore, Liberty JS 2019 Philadelphia, Amazon Community Summit London 2019, B-Sides Columbia 2019 and  in 50+ Organizations including GTU (Gujarat Technological University) and Raksha Shakti University (RSU), Nirma University, Maharaja Sayajirao Gaikvad University (MSU), Ganpat University, Nirma University, C U Shah University, PDPU (Pandit Deendayal Petroleum University), Kadi university, DA-IICT Gandhinagar and CRPF (Central Reserve Police Force) and aware more than 1 Million people about rights to privacy, cyber security, net neutrality, surveillance, issues with bio-metric scan (aadhar card) and cyber disorder.


He is working with Mozilla Foundation from last 4 years as a Mozilla Reps, also were Mentor in Mozilla Open Leadership Project and Coach (Privacy & Security) in MozSprint 2018. where my focus is advocate privacy and security, help Mozilla campus clubs and Mozilla Local Communities in India to grow more and co-coordinating with them to explore more possibility within their college campus, local community to global platform getting them involved with new opportunities, projects in Mozilla with lots of activities. Encouraging them to start their own open source projects and mentoring them from ideation stage to community ready. Coached lots of international open source projects helped them to make their project better and more open to get more contributor and engagement. he has also worked with L10N project on Pontoon, Rust, WebVR.

# Biography
My name is Xavier Martorell, I’m 21 years old and I'm from Mallorca, Spain.

I’ve been collaborating in Mozilla since I joined Mozilla Hispano in 2013 when a window pop-up on my screen asking for collaboration in Mozilla which I was not willing to refuse. I started helping in the QA Area of Mozilla Hispano with Gabriela Montagu (gaby2300) who later on would become my mentor and a really good friend.   
    
Nowadays, I'm pushing the Mozilla Hispano community forward, introducing them to the new projects which Mozilla is working on as well as trying to engage as many members as possible. This wouldn't be possible without the help of my Mozilla Hispano fellows.

Professor at FATEC Taquaritinga, works with web development (front-end and back-end) since 2006. In his spare time is a game developer and blogger.
Contributes to MDN and with community engagement in Brazil. Currently part of the Tech Speakers program and a member of Mozilla Campus Clubs advisory committee.

## Current:

Data Scientist, Software Enginner at Cisco, FOSS contributor and Mozilla Rep

## About History:

I still remember when I was in school 8th Standard, say ~13 years back, we were to write small HTML snippets. I used to use a lot of Netscape Navigator browser and then in a year or so, there was this browser named Firefox which I heard a lot. I have that curious mind, which never rests. That was when I started using Firefox. Few years passed, I then thought myself JS. It was(and is) one of the languages I admire(not just code)! That passion for JS & Mozilla grew over years. I explored about Mozilla's History, Present and thought I should be a part of their Future.
Attending every event, contributed as much as I could with that knowledge in those days. Then, got a chance to showcase Mozilla, Firefox, Firefox OS, Gecko in a bigger stage/audience. Have enjoyed the journey all along. Would like to take the next step officially and see what more I could do being a part of this amazing community.

## Interests:

Mozilla, Artificial Intelligence, Javascript

# As A Mozillian
Long-time Mozilla Community Member. Current roles include Mozilla Reps Mentor, Community Building, Add-ons Reviewer, and Evangelism. Active in [Mozilla Slovenija](http://mozilla.si) and [Mozilla Ireland](http://mozillaireland.org).

KAMI is very committed about Free Softwares so he contributes such projects like LibreOffice, Ubuntu, kdenlive, Compiz, system-config-printer and so on. He works as a system administrator in a development company which provides cutting edge technology products based on telecommunication and he uses these key technologies in his daily life.

#I Mozillian
Mozilla Bolivia community manager, collaborating with Mozilla community since 2009, mainly in l10n, localization es-BO, Guaraní, Aimara and Quechua from Bolivia, user support, spreading and organizing Mozilla events in Bolivia, Mozilla Reps and Mozilla Hispano member.

#What Do I Do?
I'm currently participating on my local community [Mozilla Bolivia](http://www.mozillabolivia.org), organizing events, working in localizations, and constant Mozilla diffusion.
I'm Master of Science Computer, currently professor of engineering in the state university of Santa Cruz, and Academic Director of the School of Engineering of Postgraduate in the state university of Santa Cruz.

# As a Mozillian 
I am a long time enthusiastic mozillian from Romania, being part of Mozilla Romania Community. I am also a Webmaker helping out anyone who want to learn to make his own web. I am spreading around Mozillian News through all Social Media account of Mozilla Romania Community, I blog for www.mozilla.ro. I also enjoy helping out in sumo and I explore my artistic side through design.  I encourage women participation in tech through WoMoz, 
#As a Rep and Mentor
I've become a Mozilla Rep and more recently I am also a Mentor. 
I love to organize and participate to different events spreading out Mozilla's mission and talk about it's products. 
I am helping out building and helping out communities guiding reps from different countries. 
# Office Hours
I am most of the time on IRC during European Working hours (7:00 - 16 UTC ). Feel free to ping me even if is outside this interval or drop me an e-mail or a tweet. I will try to get back to you asap.

## Twitter Bio
Lean product delivery aficionado. #Agile evangelist. Building Dignity volunteer. @ebbf comms advocate. Leading Mozilla's Open Innovation Participation Systems team.

## Reason for being a Mozilla Rep
I have been a fan of Mozilla ever since the Milestone Releases in 1999. Having attended the [Mozilla 1.0 Release Party in Quito](http://www.schnitzer.at/mozparty/?all=true#42) (Ecuador), I decided to host a [Firefox 1.0 Release Party in Munich](http://web.archive.org/web/20050206171150/http://carishina.net/henrik/blog/?postid=64) (Germany).

In 2010 I participated in the Drumbeat Festival in Barcelona and am part of the Webmaker community ever since.

My main contribution to Mozilla is in the area of community building with a regional focus German-speaking countries.
